name: Aston Kona by the Sea

reviews.title: Short stay in Kona
reviews.text: We arrived in Kona after a very long & stressful flight from Brisbane. Our room was ready and we had the promised Ocean View, with a very good view of the ocean & the pool from our lanai. Unfortunately, as we didn't have a vehicle, it was too far out of town to walk in for food/entertainment, and therefore we had to us a taxi every time. Although it was only around $10 each time, it was still a pain. The kitchen in the unit was very old and outdated, except for the fridge which had an excellent ice maker! However, as we were only there for 4 nights, and we only cooked on one of those, it was sufficient for our needs. Unfortunately, we couldn't open the curtain in the bedroom for some daylight, as it was directly on the walkway verandah between units.

reviews.title: Time to relax
reviews.text: We spent a week here in mid August. We reserved an ocean view 2 bd condo only to find out the ocean views are over the pool. The front desk woman offered for $20.00 a night more to see ocean front rooms. We chose one on the top floor (4th) looking directly at the ocean. The sound of the waves crashing against the shore is not only a sound I love but also drowns out any pool and barbeque noise. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. Our plans to eat out never happened as our balcony was the best place to have dinner. We will return!

reviews.title: Beautiful views!
reviews.text: The rooms and views were beautiful! We could see sea turtles from our balcony. Would stay again.

reviews.title: Great condo, great staff and great location, would definitely stay again
reviews.text: My Wife and I got just returned from an 11 day vacation to the Big Island to relax and visit family who just moved to the island. Kona By The Sea is a very good condo resort. The staff was very nice and helpful in everyway. Upon arrival, our first condo (Unit 409) had a couple of issues, but the office manager put us in a different unit (Unit 309) which was fantastic. We stayed in a 1 bedroom, 2 bath oceanfront unit and the view was beautiful. Very good appointments and all worked well. We also met some very nice people there who were long time returning guests as well. No hassles at all, you couldn't ask for a better vacation. However, my Wife and I were very disappointed with the housekeeping. No dusting, no vacuuming, did not clean lanai or entry way (very dirty feet) or do anything in the living room. Maybe our sheets were changed only once the whole time. Also, we found crumbs and pepper flakes (we had no pepper in the unit) on the dining table, so the maid had lunch in our place and didn't bother to clean the mess. Other than the bad housekeeping, everything else was fine.

reviews.title: Holiday in Paradise perfection... not quite, but very good.
reviews.text: Having done lots of research we chose this hotel because we read a lot of good reviews about it. The accommodation also included free parking facility for the guests, which few others had, (This proved invaluable as it had underground spaces so the car was protected and cool before a trip) It looked good on their web sites and seemed to offer what we were looking for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in unit 111, a one bedroom, two bath unit. We were completely pleased with the unit. The kitchen was well equipped. The air conditioner worked great. The unit was well appointed. All appliances worked fine. The view was wonderful from the private lanai. The daily cleaning service was timely and efficient. We thoroughly enjoyed the stay.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was disappointed that the Aston wanted to charge a 10.00 per day amenity fee, but they were good enough to waive the fee in our case since it was not noted on our reservation confirmation. Had it not been waived, it would have been 10 per day for things we did not want nor would have used (the safe, daily coffee, daily newspaper, internet access). If a resident needs those services, the rate is probably reasonable, but the choice should be left up to the individual traveler based on their needs.
reviews.title: Definately going back

reviews.text: This was the second time we stayed in this complex. We last stayed two years ago and were impressed so we decided to return. We will again. The apartment we stayed in this time was on a lower floor so we found the view looling through the coconut trees to be fantastic. This place you can relax to the max or travel around depending on your inclination. Far enough out of Kailua to be away from the hustle and bustle (If you can call the pace that in any event), but near enough to walk if you like hitting the roads, about a 30 minute walk to town. We have stayed in the one bedroom apartment and found them really good. Everything you want and the pool is the right size and is never crowded to the extent it puts you off. They have barby's that you can use and these are cleaned daily. The maids are in daily and we found they will call back if you are still in your room. The staff at the hotel are so helpful. I had an issue with waiting for a parcel to arrive and the hotel were great. Good communication and the Manager Brian could not do enough. Very impressed with the service. Will definately be back.
reviews.title: Fantastic place -- views that are 1/4th cost at other Kona coast resorts

reviews.text: We had 2 units (2br & 1br). Both were clean and well furnished. The kitchens were adequately stocked with utensils. Because this is a Timeshare you can expect some differences in the units (some have older appliances). Every unit in the building we were in has a view like the attached. The 4 Seasons does not have a room with a better view. In fact, most of their rooms do not have views anything like the view we had. The surf provides sound 24 hours per day :-)
reviews.title: Nice place - great view- Rm 102 needs updating.

reviews.text: First time in Hawaii. Arrived Sat. Aug 11th. Condo was perfect for us - a family of 6 ages 21 to 59. Kitchen had everything you would need to cook with pretty good appliances. Location was beautiful - towards the end of the building away from the pool but with a beautiful view of the ocean. Parking was under the building and easy. Gas grills near the pool were great - well lit as we cooked out after arriving home at 8"30pm. However, the shower in the 2nd bedroom was hard to set - either too hot or too cold and on Mon. night after being at the beach all day the shower knob in the masterbedroom just fell off the fixture. As we now had no shower in the unit, I went down to the desk and was told they had no one to fix it until the next morning.They gave us a key to another condo and told us to use those showers.However, that uni twas not on the same floor as our unit so we had to bring all our shower stuff upstairs to the other condo. Abit of an inconvience. Even though we had the shower problem, I would probably stay here again if we came back.
reviews.title: Great family vacation

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights and what a way to go to sleep at night with the waves crashing onto the rocks. The sunsets and views were awesome and the pool and spa were a favourite with our 2 year old twins.
reviews.title: Waves crashing at night.

reviews.text: We had a 2 bedroom apartment and it was huge. There was a washing machine and dryer which was very handy so we could do our washing before flying back to Honolulu the next day.
reviews.title: Just got home from Kona on the Big Island

reviews.text: Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Kona.
reviews.title: Not as advertised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great condo. We had a 2bd 2b room 112. This was oceanfront and awesome view. Each unit is different , Aston runs the property but the units are owned by a private party. Some rooms are nicer than others. But if you find any kind of problem management is quick to fix. The staff was wonderful and very friendly. On the Big Island not a lot of nice beaches, lots of rocky areas. Our resort had a great pool over looking the ocean. They have a sandy area between the ocean and pool area withe gas grills. Ocean view breakfast, lunch and dinners made your way. They do not have a bar or dining room at the resort. But a quick stop at Safeway or Costco will get you all needed items. Shopping and dining are just a few miles away or a $6.00 cab ride. The best part about this resort is no added fees at check out. Awesome choice for anyone.
reviews.title: The Best Condo in Hawaii

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel 2 adults, 2 teenagers. We had stayed at Aston Kaanapali shores and loved it so had high expectations for this one. When we arrived, the first thing was they had a reservation for 4 nights instead of 3. Their mistake and they corrected it. The I noticed a sign on the pool and whirlpool that said "out of service". I inquired and they told me it would be out for 2 days due to a hole. Then we went to our apartment which was very seedy. The carpeting (lime green) was stained and dirty. The walls (lime green commercial color) were marked up and dirty. The bathroom was OK but not up to standard nor was the kitchen. I asked if they had a more updated room but they said not for 2 days so we stayed put. The DVD played did not work and they kept forgetting to give us coffee. I finally asked what the "$10 amenity fee" was for and they refunded it. There is no beach to swim in or even walk along, just a small "beach" with chairs to sit in. Do not be fooled by the photos on the website. Our unit looked nothing like that.
reviews.title: Much better than we anticipated
Great location, room needed some attention.
reviews.text: My DH and I started our 10 day stay on the Big Island at Kona by the Sea. We spent 5 days in a one bedroom/2 bath oceanfront condo. The view was awesome and the extra room of a condo allows us to spread out and relax. We love having a kitchen to fix breakfast and a few other meals since my DH has a food allergy. Our unit had 2 bathrooms which was very nice although they could use more counter space. The unit we had was not updated and was in need of a little love, but we didn't let this bother us. (We arrived late in the evening and were told there was only this one unit available.) The location alone is just about perfect. Not too far from town and was fairly quiet while we were there. Also having a washer and dryer is a great help since we can pack less.

reviews.title: Outstanding Room with an Awesome View!!
reviews.text: No real beach for walking on, but not an issue for me. I just stayed on their little beach and enjoyed watching the waves or the occasional surfers.

reviews.title: Loved kona by the sea....quiet and peaceful. Maybe too quiet?
reviews.text: The staff we encountered was always very pleasant and helped with any needs. We would certainly stay here again when we return to the Big Island. We enjoy Aston properties and have stayed with them on Maui and Oahu as well.

reviews.title: Great vacation - minor glitches
reviews.text: Some cons: the unit needed the carpeting replaced or changed to tile as it was stained and worn.

reviews.title: A great vacation
reviews.text: The kitchen came with barely the necessities, but since it was only the two of us we managed.

aka: Aston Kona By The Sea Hotel Kailua-Kona
description: An intimate, oceanfront resort with breathtaking views and spacious suites. This condominium resort fronts a magnificent rocky shoreline with its own sandy lounging area, outdoor barbecue facilities and more. Located just south of historic Kailua-Kona with its charming shops, dining and nightlife.
